properties.name: camel.component.google-mail-stream.access-token
properties.description: OAuth 2 access token. This typically expires after an hour so refreshToken is recommended for long term usage.

properties.name: camel.component.google-mail-stream.application-name
properties.description: Google mail application name. Example would be camel-google-mail/1.0

properties.name: camel.component.google-mail-stream.autowired-enabled
properties.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

properties.name: camel.component.google-mail-stream.bridge-error-handler
properties.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

properties.name: camel.component.google-mail-stream.client-factory
properties.description: The client Factory. The option is a org.apache.camel.component.google.mail.GoogleMailClientFactory type.

properties.name: camel.component.google-mail-stream.client-id
properties.description: Client ID of the mail application

properties.name: camel.component.google-mail-stream.client-secret
properties.description: Client secret of the mail application

properties.name: camel.component.google-mail-stream.configuration
properties.description: The configuration. The option is a org.apache.camel.component.google.mail.stream.GoogleMailStreamConfiguration type.

properties.name: camel.component.google-mail-stream.delegate
properties.description: Delegate for wide-domain service account

properties.name: camel.component.google-mail-stream.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable auto configuration of the google-mail-stream component. This is enabled by default.

properties.name: camel.component.google-mail-stream.health-check-consumer-enabled
properties.description: Used for enabling or disabling all consumer based health checks from this component

properties.name: camel.component.google-mail-stream.health-check-producer-enabled
properties.description: Used for enabling or disabling all producer based health checks from this component. Notice: Camel has by default disabled all producer based health-checks. You can turn on producer checks globally by setting camel.health.producersEnabled=true.

properties.name: camel.component.google-mail-stream.labels
properties.description: Comma separated list of labels to take into account

properties.name: camel.component.google-mail-stream.mark-as-read
properties.description: Mark the message as read once it has been consumed

properties.name: camel.component.google-mail-stream.max-results
properties.description: Max results to be returned

properties.name: camel.component.google-mail-stream.query
properties.description: The query to execute on gmail box

properties.name: camel.component.google-mail-stream.raw
properties.description: Whether to store the entire email message in an RFC 2822 formatted and base64url encoded string (in JSon format), in the Camel message body.

properties.name: camel.component.google-mail-stream.refresh-token
properties.description: OAuth 2 refresh token. Using this, the Google Calendar component can obtain a new accessToken whenever the current one expires - a necessity if the application is long-lived.

properties.name: camel.component.google-mail-stream.scopes
properties.description: GMail scopes

properties.name: camel.component.google-mail-stream.service-account-key
properties.description: Sets .json file with credentials for Service account

properties.name: camel.component.google-mail.access-token
properties.description: OAuth 2 access token. This typically expires after an hour so refreshToken is recommended for long term usage.

properties.name: camel.component.google-mail.application-name
properties.description: Google mail application name. Example would be camel-google-mail/1.0

properties.name: camel.component.google-mail.autowired-enabled
properties.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

properties.name: camel.component.google-mail.bridge-error-handler
properties.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

properties.name: camel.component.google-mail.client-factory
properties.description: To use the GoogleCalendarClientFactory as factory for creating the client. Will by default use BatchGoogleMailClientFactory. The option is a org.apache.camel.component.google.mail.GoogleMailClientFactory type.

properties.name: camel.component.google-mail.client-id
properties.description: Client ID of the mail application

properties.name: camel.component.google-mail.client-secret
properties.description: Client secret of the mail application

properties.name: camel.component.google-mail.configuration
properties.description: To use the shared configuration. The option is a org.apache.camel.component.google.mail.GoogleMailConfiguration type.

properties.name: camel.component.google-mail.delegate
properties.description: Delegate for wide-domain service account

properties.name: camel.component.google-mail.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable auto configuration of the google-mail component. This is enabled by default.

properties.name: camel.component.google-mail.lazy-start-producer
properties.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

properties.name: camel.component.google-mail.refresh-token
properties.description: OAuth 2 refresh token. Using this, the Google Calendar component can obtain a new accessToken whenever the current one expires - a necessity if the application is long-lived.

properties.name: camel.component.google-mail.scopes
properties.description: GMail scopes

properties.name: camel.component.google-mail.service-account-key
properties.description: Service account key in json format to authenticate an application as a service account. Accept base64 adding the prefix base64:
